page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY AND TOURISM
page.content: {Stanford Hall,}a mile from Swinford is the residence of the present descendants of the{Cave Family,}Lord and Lady Braye, their daughter Penelope and son-in-law Lt.Col. Edward Aubrey-Fletcher. The original Hall was pulled down and rebuilt by Smiths of Warwick in 1690, and is an excellent example of a 'William and Mary' dwelling. Today it is not only a residence open to the public but a venue for car, motor cycle and balloon rallies. Adjacent to the house is a{motor cycle {and car museum,}also the{Pilcher {Aviation Museum}in which a replica of 'The Hawk', the flying machine in which{Lieut. Percy Pilcher R.N.,}the first man to fly in England was killed at Stanford in 1899. There is also a memorial to Pilcher on the spot where he crashed.
